roleset.name: (cause to) become dark
roleset.note: DARKEN-V NOTES: Verbnet entry other_cos-45.4, big surprise. (from darken.01-v)

example.name: unaccusative
example.text: He darkened under his heavy burn.

example.name: transitive
example.text: For a moment, anger darkened the hallway about her, and when she found her voice, anger thickened it.

example.name: pretentious literary usage
example.text: The darkening world scene, at the time of the Munich Pact, continued to trouble his mind even in his remote Virginia studio.

roleset.name: not reflecting much, if any, light
roleset.note: DARK-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-4,5. related to 'darken.01'. (from dark.01-j)
DARKER-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from darker.01-j)

role.descr: specific part of arg1, if also mentioned

example.name: Muhammed Ali
example.text: I'm so fast that last night I turned off the light switch in my hotel room and was in bed before the room was dark.

example.name: lexicalized comparative: arg1 and CXN
example.text: I 'm very pale caucasian and my chest is darker than my face , if I were to match to my chest I 'd just look a bit mucky , like I had n't washed in weeks , and I think that if your foundation does n't completely blend into your natural skintone along your jawline you can look like you 're wearing a mask .

example.name: applies to eye and hair
example.text: Unlike her late husband, Mitchell was dark of eye, dark of hair, dark dark dark of character.

roleset.name: morbid, depressive, evil, macabre
roleset.note: DARK-J NOTES: Added by Julia. (from dark.02-j)

role.descr: specific aspect of arg1 that is macabre

example.name: both args: applies to 'character' only
example.text: Unlike her late husband, Mitchell was dark of eye, dark of hair, dark dark dark of character.
